723260f-a.text:
South Street, west side, north from and including Wall Street. Also shown, is Wall Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Nouth Strcet. To-day (1937), a large of5ice building, No. 120 Wall Street, stands on the
area, shown in the foreground.

723264f-a.text:
South Street, west side, south from Wall Street, showing prominently the buildings at the S. W. corner prior to their later demolition, as shown in View 2. This space will be utilised as a gas station. Note the smokestack atop the new U.S. Assay Office at Old Slip. Beyond is the cross atop the Seamens
Church Institute at Coenties Slip.
1: Warch 27, 1931
2: Sept. 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
723264f-a.folder: South Street & Wall Street, Manhattan, NY

723264f-b.folder: South Street & Wall Street, Manhattan, NY

723961f-a.text: Wall Street, west from South Street, showing the easterly terminus of this important financial thoroughfare. At the right margin appears a portion of the American Sugar Refiners Bldg., No. 120 Wall Street. Beyond is the dominant Bank of Manhattan Bldg. at No. 40 Wall Street. The pyramidally roofed Bank of New York is overshadowed. The triangular apex of the Brown Boos. Bldg. juts out in the center. The remainder of this and the outstanding City Bank-Farmers Trust Co. Bldg. are obscured from view by the office structure under construction in the midground at Front Street.
723961f-a.folder: Wall Street & South Street, Manhattan, NY

723965f-a.text:
Wall Street, west from, but not including South Street. Note the Bank of Manhattan Building,(40 Wall Street) towering over all.
October 14, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

723967f-a.folder: Wall Street & South Street, Manhattan, NY

723259f-a.text:
South Street, at the foot of Wall Street, showing the Downtown Skyport overshadowed by the 60 Wall Tower. To the right is the Sugar Refiners Building, at No. 120 Wall Street.
Commuters from Long Island find this service a rapid means of transportation daily.
October 1, 1938
Views: 1 and 2
George D. Chinn
Summer 1939
W. A. Lucus  View: 3

723265f-a.text:
South Street, at the foot of 9all Street, showing the Downtown Air Port on the East River. This provides transportation facilities for various suburbanites. South Street forms the marginal thoroughfare; Wall Street is thru the center. At the right is the base of the 33 storied American Sugar Refining Co. Blda..
No. 120 Wall Street
September 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
723265f-a.folder: South Street & Wall Street, Manhattan, NY

723263f-a.text:
South Street, at the N.W. corner of Wall Street, showing a gas station there. South Street is at the left, and Wall Street is at the right. View 2 is photographed from Wall Street at Front Street and is towards the Downtown
Sky Port at the East River's edge.
1: May 8, 1940
2: June 16, 1940
P. L. Sperr
